meanings.definition: A smooth, glossy fabric typically made of silk or nylon and used for clothing or linens.
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful dress made of satins to the party.
meanings.sent2: The bride's gown shimmered in the light, showcasing the elegance of satins.
meanings.sent3: The cat curled up on the soft satins of the bed, purring contentedly.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as smooth as satins, calming everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The luxurious feel of satins against her skin made her feel like royalty.

meanings.definition: A garment made of satin fabric.
meanings.sent1: He admired the intricate details of the satins hanging in the boutique.
meanings.sent2: The designer showcased a collection of satins at the fashion show.
meanings.sent3: The satins whispered softly as she moved, creating a melodious rustle.
meanings.sent4: The satins draped elegantly over her shoulders, enhancing her beauty.
meanings.sent5: The rich colors of the satins caught the sunlight, creating a mesmerizing display.

meanings.definition: To finish a metal surface to a high gloss.
meanings.sent1: He carefully polished the metal to satins, reflecting his own image.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman's skilled hands transformed the dull metal into satins.
meanings.sent3: The sunlight gleamed off the satins of the metal, blinding anyone who looked directly at it.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed in the workshop as she worked to satin the metal surface.
meanings.sent5: The metal shone like satins under the bright lights, dazzling all who passed by.
